definition: Sichuan fritillary bulb (Bulbus fritillariae cirrhosae, used in TCM)
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
river/creek/plain/an area of level country
cowrie/shellfish/currency (archaic)
surname Bei

sentences.english: This paper introduced the characteristics and its higy-yielding oultural techniques of "Chuanbei 1".
sentences.chinese: 該文主要介紹了川貝1號的特徵特性及栽培技術要點。

sentences.english: An HPLC-ESI/MS method was developed for analysis of alkaloids in Bulbus Fritillariae.
sentences.chinese: 此方法可用於對市場上川貝母和浙貝母的質量監控。

sentences.english: I plan to buy some herb Chuan Bei tomorrow to put together with sugar.
sentences.chinese: 明天我打算買點川貝，自制冰糖川貝燉雪梨。

sentences.english: I plan to buy some herb Chuan Bei tomorrow to put together with sugar.
sentences.chinese: 明天我打算買點川貝，自制冰糖川貝燉雪梨。

definition: dwarf lilyturf (Ophiopogon japonicus), its tuber used in TCM
variant of 黃檗|黄檗[huang2 bo4]
dried fruit of immature citron or trifoliate orange (used in TCM)
black atractylodes rhizome (dried rhizome of any of several atractylodes species) (TCM)
chebulic myrobalan (Terminalia chebula)
dried ginger
monk fruit, the sweet fruit of Siraitia grosvenorii, a vine of the Curcubitaceae family native to southern China and northern Thailand, used in Chinese medicine
radish seed (used in TCM to treat indigestion)
to reduce fever
ladybell root (Radix adenophorae)
Chinese yam (Dioscorea polystachya)
milk vetch/plant genus Astragalus/huangqi 黃芪|黄芪, Astragalus membranaceus (used in TCM)
Ningpo figwort (Scrophularia ningpoensis)/root of Ningpo figwort (used in TCM)
Salvia miltiorrhiza
to ease constipation (TCM)
cicada slough/fig. to free oneself/to extricate oneself from
